page.title: 15The Survey (cont)
page.content: doctors, railway stations,bus stations and so on.Quite a few of the fields were kept as enclosed rough grazing land although a few towards the extreme S.E. corner were used for crops such as barley.Everwhere is covered in fields,woodland and vegetation of some kind or other.We passed one Inn on our survey (The Bull's Head) and nine farms:Pettifor's Farm,Rise Rocks Farm,Burch Hill Farm, Charley Mill Farm,Greenhill Lodge Farm ,Upper Greenhill Farm, Irish Farm and Kellam's Farm_although not all of them are still fully working farms.We also noticed that our area is well covered by signposted footpaths all of which are obviously frequently used by local people.
